wordpressWpPostsEn.title: A Better Internet
wordpressWpPostsEn.content:
This won’t be a technical article, neither about a new stack or development metodology. However, I would like to share my experience and opinion about internet as a web developer and user.

We may have endless good reasons to love the internet; it closer people, it allows access information easyly, simplify proccess that I done before with more efford (such as shopping, paying bills, checking our bank account). Internet is in a huge part of ours lives and tends to become even more present in the future.

On the other hand, companies and politicians also use it to their own benefits and not so much to good of people. I know that there is not a book with Internet’s commandments and how it must be used, however, as a person that always tries to do something good, I truly believe we, developers, should take advantage of our ability to reach so many people and positively influence their lives with our jobs.

As developers, we always contribute with open source community, we try to solve problems or improve products that we’re working on. What if we take these abilities beyond our job to build a better internet?

Let me give my example, In 2014 I was diagnosticated with Crohn’s disease, a autoimune inflammatory illness with no cure, at that time I barely found information about it and after had learnt how to live with the disease, I decided to create a simple blog with WordPress to share everything that I’d learnt. Through that blog I helped plenty of patience, I made friends and I was invited to participate in events.

I also made work volunteer with homeless in SÃ£o Paulo city with a non-governmental organization and I built their website for free to their have more visibility and investing.

Another example, we are currently passing through a coronavirus pandemic and on the 27th, 28th and 29th of March happened the #CodeVsCOVID19, an online marathon with hundreds of developers, designers, mentors from over the world, working together in teams to create solutions for people who are being affected by the coronavirus.

I even built a website showing the numbers of infected, deaths and recovered people in Brazil and worldwide.

These opportunities are great to start learning a new stack, a different project’s architecture, beside increase your portfolio as a developer and help other people.

There are endless causes that we may help, like:

  • Blinded people.
  • Elderly people.
  • Orphan children
  • Refugees.
  • Homeless.
  • Climate change.

I don’t propose to end all these problems but to facilitate them through the Internet, be it connecting people, raising funds, sharing information. One thing I have been learning these years working with other developers is that we are great at thinking about solutions to problems.

And with that, we have the possibility to create a better Internet for everyone, and I’m not talking about performance or other technical metrics ðŸš€
